review: This was fairly easy to set up.  However, we could not get smooth reception on our HDTV set.  We have DSL so I'm guessing our internet connection wasn't fast enough.  It was strange, though, because I could watch the same video on my PC, using the same DSL internet connection, and the video reception would be just fine.  We don't watch much TV, so, since the reception with this wasn't that great, I sold our Chromecast on EBAY.
author: Mercury Man

review: Ok, a few things.  I set this up on my home TV, very quick to setup and easy to use.  There seems to be a lot that Google has not taken from beta to real life yet though.  I can cast off my phone for You Tube and Netflix which is wonderful, but why I cannot cast off the Chrome browser on my phone is a mystery to me.  I took this to do a presentation and hooked it up to a projector and it setup fairly easily on the facility's network but had major issues with the Chrome browser stopping casting in the middle of the presentation.  This was very frustrating and dashed my high hopes of making presentations with it.  But for $35 you can't beat it and we will continue to use it a home.  Hopefully in time it will be better supported with better documentation and functionality by Google.  I'm also hoping that it will be a bit more stable.  I have had this devices for about 3 months now.
